record.field: Please check whether the lines to pay are all related to a claim invoice.
Cancelled indemnification %(indemnification)s can't be refused.
Indemnification %(indemnification)s must have a note to be canceled, please write a note to motivate your refusal.
End date must be greater than the start date.
Indemnifications in the future are not allowed.
The end date must not exceed the loss end date.
End date is required.
Start date is required.
The journal is required.
The beneficiary is required.
No salary defined on the claim %(claim)s.
No indemnifications on the claim to compare with.
A crash occurs while computing the indemnification, see stack trace for more informations.
The computed amount is different from the last indemnfication. We should have %(amount)s, got %(computed)s instead.
The indemnification rule returns no indemnification.
No ijss defined in previous indemnification details.
Share for current beneficiary: %(share)s %%
Total after share: %(amount).2f
No indemnification rule defined.
Indemnification computed with forced base amount %(forced_amount)s Indemnification amount is %(forced_amount)s * %(nb_of_unit)s = %(amount)s.
Capital forced amount %(forced_amount)s.
Annuities generated with forced base amount %(forced_amount)s on a %(frequency)s frequency. Therefore, annual annuity amount is %(annual_forced_amount)s.

The prorata for this period is %(prorata)s / %(ratio)s = %(prorata_on_ratio)s The amount per day is %(annual_forced_amount)s / %(ratio)s = %(amount_per_unit)s. The annuity amount is %(amount_per_unit)s * %(prorata)s = %(annuity_amount)s.
Detail %(detail_key) does not exist in configuration for deductible rules.

Some draft losses have active indemnifications, they may have to be reevaluated:
%(names)s
Total share amount for service %(service)s should be 100: %(total_share)s %%.
The end date is missing on the loss.
The closing reason is missing on the loss.
%(count)s indemnification(s) remains unpaid.
A gap has been detected from %(from_)s to %(to)s
No indemnification has been found.
Are you sure you want to cancel the periods between %(start)s and %(end)s?
The date is not equal to the cancelled date.
There may not be multiple capital indemnifications for a given beneficiary, the current one will be cancelled.
The period "%(description)s" will be definitely deleted for the calculation, event if you cancel the process.
The service %(service)s has non-cancelled indemnifications.
The insurer %(insurer)s did not allow to create indemnifications.
The insurer %(insurer)s did not allow to pay indemnifications.
Cannot schedule indemnifications for draft loss %(loss)s.
Cannot schedule indemnifications as there is cancelled indemnification not scheduled for service %(service)s.
No bank account found for the beneficiary %(beneficiary)s on loss %(loss)s.
You can not schedule the indemnification %(indemnification)s because a scheduled period of %(missing_days)s day(s) should be ahead.

The tax %(tax)s starts on %(tax_start)s and ends on %(tax_end)s . Please create different indemnifications between %(period_start)s and %(period_end)s so that no tax changes happen during a given indemnification.
The following indemnification period(s) duplicates the period to schedule (same benefit, loss and option):
%(covered)s: with the contract number: %(ctr)s, claim: %(number)s, period: %(period)s (%(overlap)s day(s) of overlap).
The following indemnification period(s) duplicates the period to schedule (with another loss):
Scheduling is blocked for indemnification %(indemnification)s, claim's sub status is %(sub_status)s.
Scheduling is blocked for indemnification %(indemnification)s, contract %(contract)s is not activated.
Capital
The indemnification %(indemnification)s cannot be removed.
Invalid configuration: the revaluation rule is called with invalid parameters.
